text: Sir John Edwin Enderby (16 January 1931 - 3 August 2021) was a British physicist. From 1976 to 1996 he was professor of physics at the University of Bristol. From 2004-2006 he was the president of the Institute of Physics. In 2004 he received a knighthood for services to science. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. Enderby died on 3 August 2021, aged 90.Neutron-science pioneer John Enderby dies aged 90 ==References== Category:1931 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Academics of the University of Bristol Category:British physicists Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire Category:Fellows of the Royal Society Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: John Enderby
